de.ryanthara.ja.rycon

Class Main

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.ryanthara.ja.rycon.Main
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MainApplication

    public abstract class Main
extends java.lang.Object
    Main implements values, constants and objects for the complete RyCON application as an abstract class.

    This class was implemented after version 1 of RyCON to get easier access to different things. The main idea to do this step was influenced by the code base of JOSM, which is the most popular java written editor for OpenStreetMap data.

    Since:
    2

    • Method Detail

      • checkCommandLineInterfaceArguments

        protected static void checkCommandLineInterfaceArguments(java.lang.String... args)
        Checks the command line interface and it's given arguments.

        RyCON accept a couple of simple command line interface (cli) arguments. At the moment there are the following parameters implemented and can be used as described.

        --help shows the help and the valid cli arguments --locale=[LOCALE] [LOCALE] in ISO 639 alpha-2 or alpha-3 language code (e.g. de for GERMAN, en for ENGLISH) --file=[input file] [input file] input file with path which is used in the source text field

        Parameters:
        args - command line interface arguments
        Since:
        5

      • checkJavaVersion

        protected static void checkJavaVersion()
        Checks the current JAVA version.

        During the startup of RyCON the version of the installed JRE is checked. RyCON can be started only if a minimum version of a JRE is installed on the system. This is due to swt dependencies and java dependencies.

        At minimum a JRE version of 1.7 is necessary and must be installed on the target system.

        Since:
        2

      • checkRyCONVersion

        protected static void checkRyCONVersion()
        Performs an online check for a new RyCON version.

        If a newer version of RyCON is available an info dialog is shown to the user and an update is offered. This update has to be installed manually.

        At the moment it is not planned to force an automatic update via Java Webstart functions or special routines.

        Since:
        3
